content.description: The probability that a particular electrical component operates successfully is <math alttext="three fourths" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. An electrical system consists of three such components that operate independently. The system will function successfully if at least one of the three components operates successfully.
content.question: What is the probability that the system will function successfully?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

topic.text: 4.6: Independent Events and Unions of Events

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
